did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Cornell University Library Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections exhibition materials, 1992-2018

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Cornell University. Library. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Division exhibit items, records, and related material.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Division was formed in 1992 with the combination of the Department of Rare Books, the Department of Manuscripts and University Archives, the History of Science Collections, and the Icelandic Collection.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Division exhibit items, records, and related material.

Also DVDs of Reunion and other exhibition-related lectures including "History of Wine," by Thomas Pinney, June 5, 2008; "The Collector and the Editor: Tales from the Mark Twain Papers," Robert H. Hirst, April 23, 2010; and "All Full of Tears and Flapdoodle: The Genius of Mark Twain," June 10, 2010.
Copy of exhibition guest book and visitor questionnaires, 2008-2009.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University. Library. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell University Library Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections exhibition materials, 1992-2012 #13-6-3306. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

History of Science materials (large envelopes of cards)
History of Science materials (letter size envelopes of cards)

scopecontent.p: Academia del Cimento, 1966; Aranzio and embryology, 1964; Laura Bassi, Physicist, 1966; Claude Bernard, 1978; the Bunsen burner, 1964; "Monuments in Clinical Medicine," 1964; Sir Humphry Davy, 1965; "Early Accounts of the Moon," 1965; Fabricius, teacher of Harvey, 1963; famous dissertations in embryology and anatomy, 1963; Goethe and color, 1966; Harvey, Dr. William, 1963; recent acquisitions in the history of geology, 1964; history of science collections, 1964; first editions of Johann Kepler, 1964; Lavoisier; books from Lavoisier's library; Leeuwenhoek and the microscope; Mendel's experiments, 1965; "Multum In Parvo," 1962; "Not recorded in NUC," 1963; printing of science and the mind of man, 1963; books in the History of Science, 1966; Ready Reckoners, 1964; Rösel von Rosenhof's insects, 1965; Mauro Rusconi, 1965; Seba's cabinet of natural history, 1964; Niels Stensen, 1964; Emanuel Swedenborg, 1964; Trilussa's dental caricatures, 1965; Andreas Vesalius, Anatomist, 1964; William Whewell, 1966

did.unittitle: History of Science exhibition materials (small envelopes of cards)

scopecontent.p: Jacques Gautier D'Agoty, 1970; anthropology exhibit, 1976; Petrus Apianus, 1967; apples, 1966; Audubon, John James; The Bent and Broken Moon, 1969; Thomas Bewick, 1978; bindings by Ivan Ruzicka, 1973; bleaching and dyeing, 1968; Boncompagni's birthday, 1978; the Boyle collection, 1981; watercolors from Brunfels' herbal, 1977; A Salute to George Lincoln Burr, 1972; Cannabis sativa, 1970; Christmas Rose and Star of Bethlehem, 1975; the Clepsydra, 1969; Curtis' Botanical Magazine, 1982; Henry Pelouze de Forest, Cornellian 1971; early mining, 1967; Charles Estienne as anatomist, 1967; fabulous animals, 1969; facsimile editions, 1968; five Jesuit scientists, 1968; the Jay Gould cable, 1966; Albrecht von Haller, 1977; the Hollister collection, 1967; Ithaca imprints, 1968; "It's Raining Violets," 1971; "Je Le Pansay; Diew Le Guarit," 1967; treasures of Mann Library, 1977; Meleagris gallopavo, 1968; medical dissertations, 1970; music in science, 1968; natural history museums, 1972; Ornithogallum umbellatum; 1969; Eliot Porter, the seasons, 1970; the quetzal, 1971; Rédouté: liliacées, 1970; roses in June, 1970 & 1982; scientific incunabula, 1969; scientific medals, 1969 (?); "Self-Poised upon that Yellow Flower," 1967; silkworms, 1969; suspension bridges, 1970; tea, 1969; tides, 1968; travel books of science, 1968; imitators of Vesalius, 1967; Vesuvius, 1969; Viscum album, 1969-1970; Andrew D. White and the History of Science, 1965; wine making, 1971; exhibit for College of Agriculture alumni, 1977; exhibit for Will Provine's History of Science classes, 1974; exhibit for S.L.A. Upstate N.Y. meeting, 1974; L. P. Williams History of Science class; 1976; recent acquisitions: December 1972; January-September, November-December 1973; March-June, September-October, December 1974; February-December 1975; January-December 1976; January-November 1977; January, June-October 1978
